newsitem.title: GERMANY: Springer sees higher oper profit in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Springer sees higher oper profit in 1997.

text.p: German publishing group Axel Springer, the publisher of the popular Bild newspaper, said on Wednesday that it expected its operating profit for 1997 to be around 400 million marks, up from 320 million marks in 1996.

Springer's management board chairman Juergen Richter told a news conference that progress of business in the first five months of 1997 justified a forecast for operating profit to grow by around 25 to 30 percent in the full year, giving a forecast result of 400 million marks.
He said total proceeds for the January to May period this year were five percent up on the same period in 1996.
Richter added that if the firm achieved the forecast operating result, shareholders could expect an appropriate dividend payout for 1997.
